results.title: The Detour
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, Caroline Mouris and Shelby Leverington
results.brief_description: A film experienced entirely from the point of view of an elderly patient dying in a large hospital. As modern medicine struggles to keep eighty three year old Catherine Hamilton alive she struggles just as hard to die in peace. Each time she thinks she may be able to slip away, the doctors and nurses bring her back with a wonder drug, or a new machine. But Catherine continues to fight to control her own destiny with humour and dignity

results.title: The Desperate heart
results.brief_description: A modern dance solo based on a poem by John Malcolm Brinner describing the loneliness and agony resulting from the loss of a lover. A variety of camera effects and double exposures, combined with the dancing and reading by Valerie Bettis, produces an interesting experiment in modern dance film. Created, spoken and performed by Valerie Bettis; original music by Bernando Segall.

results.title: The Desert fox
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Dennis Tupicoff and Stephen Hills
results.brief_description: July, 1942, war veterans recall the best fighting animal of the era, and a great mate - the desert fox (who looks remarkably like Rommel), captured in a visual array of claymation, stop frame and animation in this war mockumentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Dennis Tupicoff and Stephen Hills

results.title: The Desert
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Michael Birch
results.brief_description: Introduces the desert biome; its geographical locations, the causes of its formation, its temperature conditions and consequent aridity; its dust storms, and its rains. Shows the diversity of the plants and animals of the desert and how they adapt to their arid environment.

results.title: The Descent
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Film Victoria, David Atkinson, John Bird and Andrew Schultz
results.brief_description: A claymation (influenced by Jan Svankmejer in sepia tones and use of stop-still animated found objects and cut-tin figurines) depicts a storm ravaged landscape of an empire. The ruling giant, ‘metal’ Queen summons her miniature servants to find and rescue her giant clay King. Like ants the small servants work together to unite the King and Queen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Film Victoria, David Atkinson, John Bird and Andrew Schultz

results.title: The Dermis probe
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams Films and Institute of Comparative Dermatography
results.brief_description: Philosophical, scientific voices intone the marvels beyond man’s comprehension, to the accompaniment of dreamy, highly coloured images and sounds. Until, finally the camera pulls back to reveal the subject of the symposium. This parody of the jargon and the relentless close-ups of didactic scientific films is actually a parable of an 800 year old story: “Elephant in the Dark” a little fable about people who feel different parts of an elephant, all believing that what they feel is the whole beast. A serious yet entertaining look at the impediments in current thought which prevent certain forms of understanding between people. Written by Idries Shah

results.title: The Dentist
results.brief_description: A Mack Sennett comedy, starring W.C. Fields as an irascible and unconventional dentist who performs entertaining antics on the golf course and in his dental offices.

results.title: The Demanding sea
results.brief_description: A record of life at sea. Two old sailors discuss their lives against a background of moving ships - frigates, tramps, liners, tankers, trawlers and tugs - and the sea, in all its moods, benign, stormy and ice-bound. Conveys an awareness of what the sea means.

results.title: The Deluge = Potop. Parts 1 and 2 [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Film Polski, Wilhelm Hollender and Jerzy Hoffman
results.brief_description: This is a film of epic proportions somewhat reminiscent to “Doctor Zhivago” in its grandness, its breathtaking scenery, superb cinematography (Jerzy Wojcik), evocative images and a fine cast of actors. Based on the Nobel prize-winning novel by author Henryk Sienkiewicz, “The Deluge” takes place in 17th century Poland, during the Polish-Swedish War (1655-1660) with the central plot revolving around the intense and often stormy love affair between the main character, Andrzej Kmicic (Daniel Olbrychski), a noble man and a soldier often erratic in temperament, and Olenka (Malgorzata Braunek) a young gentlewoman of strong beliefs and convictions who will over the course of their relationship, be forced to question the morality of the war and Andrzej’s involvement in it. Shot on location in Poland in many of the ancient and historic castles and accompanied by an original muscial score (by Kazimierz Serocki) which enhances and adds depth to the story, this is a war film with a difference. The myriad of characters representing all walks of life, from the peasants to the aristocracy, through to the soldiers in battle, weave in and out of the story adding a sense of realism and involvement for the onlooker. “Potop” was nominated for Best Foreign Film in the 1974 Academy Awards. Cast also includes Tadeusz Lomnicki, Kazimierz Wichniarz, Wladyslaw Hancza, Leszek Teleszynski. WARNING: The English subtitles are often out of sync, and sometimes too fast to read.

results.title: The Delinquents (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cutler, Wilcox, Silver Lining Entertainment, Alex Cutler, Mike Wilcox and Chris Thomson
results.brief_description: Too young to be together, too in love to be apart, Lola and Brownie’s obsessive passion for each other breaks all the rules laid down by their parents and society. Quickly branded as rebels they are forced to separate but they fight all the odds to be reunited. Stars Kylie Minogue, Charlie Schlatter and Angela Punch-McGregor Based on the novel “The Delinquents” by Criena Rohan.
